items.name: Component_NumberInput
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_NumberInput # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_NumberInput extends gs.Component ###* * The number-input component defines the logic for the number-input window * of the default In-Game UI. * * @module gs * @class Component_NumberInput * @extends gs.Component * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: (params) -> ###* * The max. number of digits of the number. * @property digits * @type number ### @digits = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(this, params.digits) ###* * The number-cursor position. * @property digits * @type number * @protected ### @cursor = 0 ###* * The current number as text. * @property number * @type string ### @number = "" ###* * Initializes the number-input component. * * @method setup ### setup: -> text = "".fill("0", @digits) return null ###* * An action-method to add a single number/digit. * * @method action_addNumber * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender The sender of the action. * @param {Object} params The params-object which need a number-property containing the digit/number to add. ### action_addNumber: (sender, params) -> number = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params.number) if @number.length == 0 and number == 0 then return if @number.length < @digits @number += number.toString() else @number = @number.replaceAt(@number.length-1, number.toString()) @setNumber(@number) ###* * An action-method to clear the number at the current cursor position. * * @method action_removeNumber * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender The sender of the action. * @param {Object} [params=null] The params-object. Can be null. ### action_removeNumber: (sender, params) -> if @number.length > 0 @number = @number.substring(0, @number.length-1) @setNumber(@number) @setNumber(@number) ###* * Puts the specified number into the UI label-objects to make it visible * on screen. * * @method setNumber * @param {string} number The number to set. ### setNumber: (number) -> text = number.lfill("0", @digits) for c, i in text @object.controls[i].controls[1].text = c # FIXME: Direct update call shouldn't be necessary. See TextInput. @object.controls[i].controls[1].update() return null gs.Component_NumberInput = Component_NumberInput
